channel.title: Photoshop fuckup
channel.description:
I decided that it would be fun to fool around with Photoshop, so I downloaded CS5 Extended Edition and a book, 'Adobe Photoshop CS5 Classroom in a book'. This book comes with a DVD containing images that are used in various lessons. Luckily, the e-book version contains a link to a site that allows you to download these images for free. But when I open the images, they all look like the one attached: There are odd stripes all over it. When I open a photo taken by myself, it doesn't fuck it up.
Here's the link to the images: http://www.peachpit.com/ebookfiles/0321712978
I'm wondering whether the images are fucked up, or is it my laptop that can't handle big images? Can someone download lesson 1 and see what it looks like?

item.title: Photoshop fuckup
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

It’s an ATI Radeon 2400, guess that could be the problem. Anyways, it’s not that much of a problem, I just have to zoom a bit and it’s fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Photoshop fuckup
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Just wierd resolutions that I expect your built in video card can’t handle at certain zoom settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Photoshop fuckup
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

sure its not a bad crack?

You’d expect that all images would look wrong, yet that’s not the case. Only a few images, like the original of the one I attached looks wrong. And one of the other images for this lesson actually works, and for other lessons too.

Edit:
This is odd. There’s a zoom option called ‘Actual pixels’, right next to ‘Fit screen’, ‘Fill screen’ etc. When I click that, it zooms in (as expected), but then it’s actually as it should be. When I zoom out again, the lines return.

So it’s not the image, I doubt it’s Photoshop, can it be my laptop?

Edit 2:
When I zoom out again, it’s fine again. So when opening it it’s wrong, I zoom in once it’s right, I zoom in again and it’s wrong again, and it continues like that.

Read full topic

sure its not a bad crack?

item.title: Photoshop fuckup
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:2, topic:377714”]Looks fine here on my laptop.
Maybe you screwed up some setting in PS[/quote]

Is the attached image looking fine too? And it can’t be the settings in PS, I haven’t been playing around with anything yet. And it’s not all images that look odd, there are some images in lesson 1 that look fine.

Read full topic
